title.narrative: Emergency Assistance to Conflict Affected Populations of the Far North, South-West and North-West regions of Cameroon: Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM)

description.narrative: In order to facilitate the provision of emergency assistance and better target conflict-affected populations in need in the Far North, South-West, and North-West of Cameroon, this project provides up-to-dateand reliable data/information aiming to inform the humanitarian responsein the country. In order to do so, IOM is conducting its Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) in the three mentioned areas. In particular, IOM is carrying out regular DTM assessments, which consist of interviews with key informants as well as displaced and affected households in order to inform the humanitarian community’s responses and support theirefforts to provide better targeted assistance. Through this project, DTMgathers information on gender and age breakdown of displaced and affected communities<(>,<)> the level of schooling of displaced children(including access of displaced children to schools, state of school premises, reasons for the non-attendance of displaced children); on the numbers and types of vulnerabilities (including disabilities) amongst displaced and affected populations; and on security and protection in displacement sites.
